cadcore

Class NurbsSurface

  • java.lang.Object
    • cadcore.NurbsSurface
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public class NurbsSurface
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    This class implements a NURBS surface, which is used for creating a 3D model of the board. The class can also represent special cases of nurbs surfaces such as bezier patches and b-spline surfaces.

      • NurbsSurface

        public NurbsSurface(int segments,
            int nr_of_points)
        Creates a nurbs surface with a given number of segments and points
        Parameters:
        segments - nr of segments
        nr_of_points - nr of points

      • NurbsSurface

        public NurbsSurface(java.lang.String stepstring,
            NurbsPoint[] cp)
        Creates a nurbs surface from a step model
        Parameters:
        stepstring - a string describing a nurbs surface on step format
        cp - an array of cartesian points

    • Method Detail

      • set_knots_bspline

        public void set_knots_bspline()
        Set the knot values to bspline representation, i.e. uniform distances between each knot value.

      • set_knots_bezier

        public void set_knots_bezier()
        Set the knot values to bezier representation, i.e. having three points with the same value

      • set_as_bezier

        public void set_as_bezier()
        Define the surface as bezier

      • set_as_bspline

        public void set_as_bspline()
        Define the surface as bspline

      • set_as_nurbs

        public void set_as_nurbs()
        Define the surface as full nurbs

      • get_surface_type

        public int get_surface_type()
        Get the surface type
        Returns:
        int number representing the surface type (1=bezier, 2=bspline, 3=nurbs)

      • set_surface_type

        public void set_surface_type(int st)
        Set the surface type
        Parameters:
        st - number representing the surface type (1=bezier, 2=bspline, 3=nurbs)

      • evaluate_always

        public void evaluate_always(boolean value)
        Decides if the surface will be evaluated at each point or approximated from a triangulated surface. Evaluating the surface is slow, but more accurate.
        Parameters:
        value - True is we want evaluate the surface in each point

      • save

        public void save(java.io.DataOutputStream dataOut)
        Saves the surface on the old .cad format
        Parameters:
        dataOut - Output stream for writing the surface

                     int point,

      • get_point_on_surface

        @Deprecated
public NurbsPoint get_point_on_surface(int segment,
                                         int point,
                                         double u,
                                         double v)
        Deprecated. This function is deprecated and is replaced by get_point_on_surface(double t, double s)
        Gets a point on the surface. For a bspline surface the position is always calculated directly by evaluating the surface function. For bezier and full nurbs surfaces the point is either estimated from the mesh or evaluated directly depending on the whether always_evaluate is set.
        Parameters:
        segment -
        point -
        u -
        v -
        Returns:
        NurbsPoint the point on the surface

      • get_point_on_surface

        public NurbsPoint get_point_on_surface(double s,
                              double t)
        Gets a point on the surface. The surface is parameterized using it's knot vectors. The parameters t and s defines a position on the surface. Use the functions getMinT(), getMaxT(), getMinS(), and getMaxS() to find the parameter space.
        Parameters:
        s -
        t -
        Returns:
        NurbsPoint the point on the surface

      • get_point_on_surface_old

        @Deprecated
public NurbsPoint get_point_on_surface_old(int segment,
                                             int point,
                                             double u,
                                             double v)
        Deprecated. 
        Gets a point on the surface using the old algorithms for bspline surfaces. These are very quick, but does not work for other surface types.
        Parameters:
        segment -
        point -
        u -
        v -
        Returns:
        NurbsPoint the point on the surface
